title.rendered: “Unyielding IDF Pursuit: The Ongoing Search for Hamas-held Captives in Gaza”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF Spokesperson, Brig. Gen. Daniel Hageri: “Until Hamas releases our captives, the IDF will continue to pursue Hamas everywhere in Gaza. No stone will be left unturned in our efforts to locate our captives.”

Attached is a link of IDF Spokesman, Brig. Gen. Daniel Hageri’s media briefing: https://bit.ly/3UbreVz

Complete translation attached:
Hamas has just released a video
of Hirsch Goldberg-Polin, a 23-year-old,
Israeli-American boy who was celebrating with his friends at the music festival in Nova, where he was violently attacked and brutally kidnapped by Hamas on October 7th.

Hirsch has been held by Hamas in Gaza for over 200 days.

133 captives are still held by Hamas in Gaza, for more than 200 days, in inhumane conditions.
Until Hamas releases our captives, the IDF will continue to pursue Hamas everywhere in Gaza.

This is an urgent call for action. No stone will be left unturned in our efforts to locate our captives.

This psychological terror film is not just a reminder of what Hamas did on October 7th,
it reminds us of how horrific this terror organization is – instilling fear in the captives, and also in their families.

To Hirsch’s parents, Rachel and John, our hearts are with you.

We will continue to do everything in our power to bring your son Hirsch and all our captives home.

Your strength continues to be an inspiration for us as we fulfill this necessary mission.
